posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked:
Programmers and electrical folks: What are your go-to cables and bits?  Must have? Here’s my start:

USB A to C  (length?)

USB A to C  (length?)

USB C to C (length?)

USB C to C (length?)

USB A to micro

USB A to micro

Ethernet cable  (programmer length, not tethering)

Ethernet cable  (programmer length, not tethering)

Ethernet tethering cable

Ethernet tethering cable

Small keyboard for mini-PC work What else is essential?

Small keyboard for mini-PC work

What else is essential?

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked:
For one more season: USB-A to the comically-oversized-USB-B.

Programmer and driver station charging cable (for us, that’s USB-C, but whatever yours are).

posts.name: Bailey
posts.cooked: extra phone chargers & power bricks extra laptop charger for drivers station/prog laptop 6” ethernet extensions (place tether port at more opportune locations on robot & save Radio ports)(Can just cut POE injectors) extra power strips 90* extension cables for everything that goes into the RIO (lower profile wiring when burying electronics) SB50 to SB120 adaptor to help teams with chargers extra Battery Beak

posts.name: Matthew L
posts.cooked:
All of the following should be certified by whatever your electrical safety authority (ul, csa, etl, etc.) and purchased from a reputable local retailer. Also, get the slightly better version cause the cheapest version tends to suck (unless the slightly better version is on sale, clearance, etc.).

a bunch of ethernet cables in a variety of lengths (preferably the thin ones or the micro ones , or maybe 90 degree cables/adapters)

maybe even get some rjclips as well to fix broken ethernet cable clips

(maybe we need to route ethernet cables better so they don’t break)

(maybe we need to route ethernet cables better so they don’t break)

a few usb to ethernet adapters

good quality high wattage (65w-140w) usb-c power adapters (to run soldering iron, charge electronics, etc.)

usb c to usb a adapter

usb hub

hot glue gun

surge protectors

extra tool battery chargers

link_counts.title: iCAN CAT6A Super Slim Ethernet Cable, 10Gbps 550MHz, 28AWG 25FT, White - Canada Computers & Electronics

posts.name: philso
posts.cooked:
Heavy duty extension cable or powerbar (12AWG, preferred), 10+ feet long, with 4+ receptacles.

Short ethernet extensions installed in robot and driver station, bulkhead mount, to serve as port savers.

A 12V to 120V inverter with SB50 connector installed on 12V input wires, on the robot cart for keeping the driver station alive when queuing, especially at the practice field at Worlds. Choose a wattage higher than the rating of the laptop charger.

posts.name: tkchan
posts.cooked:
Extra Spare 65W PD Charger for our DS laptop.  Not a cable but handy to have also is a 65W PD capable Battery (20k mAH or higher) for when you got to a practice field with no power nearby (or none at all - this happens to almost all the events for us).

USB C-C or USB A-C 100W PD rated cable (power only or power and sync be better since these can double duty to tap into the MaxSpark).

Also, a wired MOUSE (in the pit at least).

posts.name: Ian Bae
posts.cooked:
sokoloff:

For one more season: USB-A to the comically-oversized-USB-B.

and its comically long

we use 25 ft ones and ive seen teams have a 100ft one wrapped around a long 2x4
